comments.body: This entry assumes the reader knows how the `in` test works. Do we document that anywhere? If so, provide a link. If not, a short compare/contrast would be helpful here.
its documented on the Jinja2 site

ah, yeah, I see it at http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.10/templates/#in - not much detail there - we can leave out the link for now and I'll think about ways to improve the tests documentation more generally

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +117,121 @@.. versionadded:: 2.8

Ansible includes a ``contains`` test which operates similarly, but in reverse of the Jinja2 provided ``in`` test.
This is designed with the ability to allow use of ``contains`` with filters such as ``map`` and ``selectattr``::
